title: Jazz hosts productive information session with STZA on building digital Pakistan
content:
ISLAMABAD, Aug 29 (APP): Jazz, Pakistan’s leading digital operator hosted an insightful and productive information session with the Special Technology Zones Authority (STZA) aimed at establishing a long-term partnership to build a digital Pakistan.
The session underscored the commitment of both organizations to fostering innovation and enhancing Pakistan’s technology ecosystem, with both sides expressing strong enthusiasm for future collaborations to drive the nation’s digital transformation, said a news release.
Chief Legal Officer at Jazz said Saima Kamila Khan, “We are honoured to have hosted the STZA team and to explore the potential of our collaboration. At Jazz, we believe in collaboration to drive meaningful change, and the session has solidified our shared vision of a digitally empowered Pakistan, especially as Jazz transitions to the ServiceCo model.
STZA’s crucial role in shaping Pakistan’s digital landscape and boosting the economy through technology-driven initiatives is commendable, promoting exports, entrepreneurship, job creation, and innovation. Together, we aim to drive innovation and position Pakistan as a leader in the global digital arena.”
Chief Legal Officer at STZA Iqra Musaddaq, , thanked Jazz for organizing the insightful session and said, “We had an incredible experience during this session. The interactions with the Jazz team across various departments encouraged and inspired us. We look forward to establishing a long-term partnership with Jazz, Pakistan’s digital leader, to uplift the country’s technology eco-system that will drive innovation and contribute meaningfully to the nation’s digital future.”
